title: Judge Questions Gregory Bovino Over Immigration Crackdown Tactics
summary: Gregory Bovino, a Border Patrol official who has become a public face of President Trump’s crackdown, was ordered to give the federal judge a daily report on the actions of his team from now on.

title: Federal Union’s Demand to End Shutdown Fails to Sway Democrats
summary: Senate Republicans cited a call by the American Federation of Government Employees to pass a funding extension in an attempt to pressure Democrats to relent. The effort fell flat.

title: Trump Says He Is Prepared to Send ‘More Than the National Guard’ Into U.S. Cities
summary: In a speech to American troops assembled in Japan on Tuesday, President Trump said he would escalate his orders to active-duty branches of the military if he decides it is appropriate.

title: Mike Johnson Dismisses Trump Third Term Talk — But Applauds the ‘Trolling’
summary: The speaker said he did not see a path to amending the Constitution to allow the president to seek a third term, but that it was fun to pretend he could to inflame Democrats.

title: Scenes From the Caribbean as Hurricane Melissa Hits
summary: The system made landfall in Jamaica on Tuesday afternoon, causing widespread flooding and destruction.

title: Cuba Is No Stranger to Hurricanes
summary: In the last 25 years, a total of 10 major hurricanes have lashed the island. “Cuba is right in the center of things,” a weather historian said.

title: Official’s Access to F.B.I. Files in Charlie Kirk Case Drew Pushback
summary: An inquiry by Joe Kent, who leads the National Counterterrorism Center, is said to have alarmed Kash Patel, the F.B.I. director.

title: After Charlie Kirk’s Death, Brilyn Hollyhand Steps Into the Ring
summary: In a crowded field of would-be successors, Brilyn Hollyhand hopes to capture the minds of young conservatives across America.

title: Netanyahu Orders Strikes in Gaza, as Israel Says Hamas Violated Cease-Fire
summary: The office of the Israeli prime minister said Tuesday evening that he had ordered “forceful strikes,” accusing Hamas of firing on Israeli troops and failing to return hostages’ bodies.

title: A Twist in the Candy Cane Park Murder Investigation in Oregon
summary: An unlikely twist in the investigation of a killing in 1983 that still haunts a small town in Oregon.

title: What Zohran Mamdani Learned as an Africana Studies Major at Bowdoin
summary: The mayoral candidate has said his education was formative. But critics say that his degree exemplifies how colleges steep students in leftist dogma.

title: ‘The Beginning of a Movement’: Snapshots From a Mamdani Rally
summary: Zohran Mamdani’s rally on Sunday nearly filled Forest Hills Stadium in Queens, which holds 13,000 attendees. Here’s why some of them went, in their own words.

title: Is the Mayor’s Race Tightening?
summary: The candidates make their last push for undecided New Yorkers with early voting underway.

title: North Korea Conducts Missile Test Ahead of Trump Visit to South
summary: The country has yet to respond to President Trump’s overtures to meet again with Kim Jong-un, its leader.

title: South Korea’s Gyeongju Scrambles to Host Trump, Xi and More Leaders at APEC
summary: The authorities have been scrambling to accommodate this year’s Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation forum in Gyeongju, which is known for tombs, temples and pagodas.

title: 48 Hours Without A.I.
summary: It’s everywhere, as the author learned the hard way while making as little contact as possible with machine learning and generative artificial intelligence.

title: OpenAI Restructures as For-Profit Company
summary: The artificial intelligence company said the nonprofit that controlled the organization would receive a $130 billion stake in the new company.

title: Can a Start-Up Make Computer Chips Cheaper Than the Industry’s Giants?
summary: Substrate, a San Francisco company, is trying to take on powerhouses like the Dutch company ASML.

title: At Least 64 Dead in Rio de Janeiro as Brazilian Police Crack Down on Drug Gangs
summary: The authorities said the deadliest operation in Rio’s history had killed four police officers and at least 60 other people. It was an attack on “narco-terrorists,” the state governor said.

title: Jewish Heirs Sue the Met, Saying a van Gogh It Sold Was Nazi Loot
summary: The museum says it had no idea at the time, but the heirs say the Met curator who bought and sold the work, a former U.S. Army specialist on looting, should have known better.

title: It’s Easier Than Ever to Turn Your Dial to a Live Event
summary: Broadcast TV continues to draw big audiences. And they are increasingly getting special events, award shows and sports — lots of sports.

title: Josh Hawley: We Cannot Let 42 Million Americans Go Hungry
summary: Congress must prevent Americans from losing food assistance.

title: Adelita Grijalva Just Wants to Get to Work. The House Speaker Won’t Let Her.
summary: Mike Johnson, the speaker, won’t swear in the Democratic representative-elect from Arizona.

title: Hurricane Melissa Hit Jamaica With Devastating Force
summary: Also, the U.S. attacked four more boats. Here’s the latest at the end of Tuesday.

title: F.C.C. Changes Course on the Price of Prisoners’ Phone Calls
summary: Brendan Carr, the F.C.C. chairman, cited security concerns in rolling back most of the lower costs he voted for last year.

title: Midair Fork Attack Forces International Flight to Divert to Boston
summary: A 28-year-old man stabbed two teenagers during a flight from Chicago to Frankfurt, according to federal prosecutors.

title: UPS Has Already Cut 48,000 Workers This Year
summary: About 70 percent of the layoffs affected drivers and warehouse workers, the delivery company said.

title: A 17th-Century Crypt Shines a Light on Milan’s Most Impoverished
summary: In Milan, bones that piled under a hospital over a half-century shed light on the health and habits of some of the Renaissance era’s most impoverished people.
